intro: Pilosella dodrantalis, commonly known as the Dodrantal pearlyweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a compact cluster. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pilosella dodrantalis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
